trans-unit.source: Recognizes ink gestures.
A <xref:System.Windows.Ink.GestureRecognizer> identifies an ink gesture.
You can set the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.GestureRecognizer> to recognize all or a subset of application gestures.

To set the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.GestureRecognizer> to recognize a subset of the available gestures, pass an <xref:System.Windows.Ink.ApplicationGesture> array to the constructor or use the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.GestureRecognizer.SetEnabledGestures%2A> method.
To determine whether a <xref:System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection> contains a gesture, call the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.GestureRecognizer.Recognize%2A> method.
XAML Text Usage
You cannot use this class in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)].
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.GestureRecognizer"></xref> class.
When it is created with this constructor, the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.GestureRecognizer> recognizes all application gestures.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.GestureRecognizer"></xref> class.
Use the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.GestureRecognizer.%23ctor%2A> constructor to create a <xref:System.Windows.Ink.GestureRecognizer> that recognizes a subset of the application gestures.
An array of type <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.ApplicationGesture"></xref> that specifies the application gestures the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.GestureRecognizer"></xref> will recognize.
Releases all resources used by the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.GestureRecognizer"></xref>.
Call <xref:System.Windows.Ink.GestureRecognizer.Dispose%2A> when you finish using the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.GestureRecognizer>.
The <xref:System.Windows.Ink.GestureRecognizer.Dispose%2A> method leaves the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.GestureRecognizer> in an unusable state.

Therefore, after calling <xref:System.Windows.Ink.GestureRecognizer.Dispose%2A>, you must release all references to the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.GestureRecognizer> so the garbage collector can reclaim the memory that the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.GestureRecognizer> was occupying.
Always call <xref:System.Windows.Ink.GestureRecognizer.Dispose%2A> before you release your last reference to the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.GestureRecognizer>.
Otherwise, the resources it is using will not be freed until the garbage collector calls the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.GestureRecognizer> object's `Finalize` method.
Gets the gestures that the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.GestureRecognizer"></xref> recognizes.
An array of type <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.ApplicationGesture"></xref> that contains gestures the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.GestureRecognizer"></xref> is set to recognize.
Gets a Boolean that indicates whether the gesture recognizer is available on the user's system.
`true` if the recognition component is available; otherwise, `false`.
Looks for gestures in the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection"></xref>.

The array returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.GestureRecognizer.Recognize%2A> method is sorted by the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.GestureRecognitionResult.RecognitionConfidence%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
For example, <xref:System.Windows.Ink.GestureRecognizer.Recognize%2A> may return a <xref:System.Windows.Ink.GestureRecognitionResult> array with the following values:
Index
ApplicationGesture
RecognitionConfidence

This means that the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.GestureRecognizer> recognizes that it is very likely that the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke> is a check mark, relatively likely that the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke> in not a gesture, and not at all likely that the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke> is a curlicue or a double curlicue.

The <xref:System.Windows.Ink.GestureRecognizer.Recognize%2A> method can return an array with <xref:System.Windows.Ink.ApplicationGesture.NoGesture> at a higher <xref:System.Windows.Ink.RecognitionConfidence> than other application gestures.
This means that it is more likely that the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.Stroke> is not a gesture, as opposed to a gesture that has a lower <xref:System.Windows.Ink.RecognitionConfidence>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.StrokeCollection"></xref> to search for gestures.
An array of type <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.GestureRecognitionResult"></xref> that contains application gestures that the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.GestureRecognizer"></xref> recognized.
Sets the application gestures that the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.GestureRecognizer"></xref> recognizes.

An array of type <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.ApplicationGesture"></xref> that specifies the application gestures you wish the <xref href="System.Windows.Ink.GestureRecognizer"></xref> to recognize.
